member.summary: Represents the functionality of handling one or more message input until realizing a certain operation successfully, or until the user indicates to stop trying.

member.name: M:Library.Core.Processing.IInputHandler.ProcessInput(System.String)
member.summary: Handles a received input message, returning a success signal, a response string (indicating it's not done yet), or an interrupt signal.
member.returns:
Result.Err(response), being response a response string,
Result.Ok(true) for a success signal, or
Result.Ok(false) for an interrupt signal.

member.name: M:Library.Core.Processing.IInputHandler.GetDefaultResponse
member.summary: Returns the first message the object uses to indicate what kind of input it wants.
member.returns: A string.

member.name: M:Library.Core.Processing.IInputHandler.Reset
member.summary: Resets the processor, so it can be used again.

member.name: T:Library.Core.Processing.IInputProcessor`1
member.summary: Represents the functionality of receiving one or more input messages, and generating an object with that input.
member.typeparam: The type of the resulting object.

member.name: M:Library.Core.Processing.IInputProcessor`1.getResult
member.summary: Generates the resulting object with the obtained input.
member.remarks: This function should be called only after a call to returns (true, null), which is a signal that the object's ready to produce the result.
member.returns:
Result.Ok(result), being result the resulting object, or
Result.Err(error), being error an error string.

member.name: M:Library.Core.Processing.IInputProcessor`1.GenerateFromInput(System.String)
member.summary: Receives an input message, returning the resulting object if it's ready.
member.returns:
(result, null), being result the resulting object,
(null, response), being response a response string, or
(null, null) for an interrupt signal.
